tn.text: the chief priest who served in the temple and was faithful to God. He was an advisor to Joash. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: when he comes in and when he goes out
tn.text: Possible meanings are 1) "at all times" or 2) "wherever he goes." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: all Judah served in every way in the manner in which Jehoiada the priest commanded
tn.text: AT: "most of the people were obedient to the commands of the high priest" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])

tn.ref: were to leave off serving on the Sabbath
tn.text: AT: "were finishing their work on that Sabbath day"
AT: "Recited the terms of the covenant"

tn.ref: All the people of the land

tn.text: AT: "who were leaders in the army"
AT: "in the midst of the soldiers"

tn.ref: all the people went to the house of Baal
tn.text: AT: "almost all the people went to the temple of Baal" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])

tn.ref: under the hand of the priests
tn.text: AT: "under the direction of the priests"

tn.ref: no one that was unclean in any way should enter
tn.text: AT: "no one unclean is allowed to enter for any reason"

tn.ref: He brought down the king from the house of Yahweh
tn.text: The temple was built on the highest hill in Jerusalem. AT: "He brought the king from the temple at the top of the hill to the palace"
